column4: Are there any differences between running Ubuntu 32bit on a 32bit CPU and running Ubuntu 32bit on a AMD64 CPU?
if you run the 32bit (ie i386) version you are 100% compatible with a regular pentium type system
nothing special ever, it's completely identical - the amd64/emt64 CPUs have the full 32bit instruction set available
then, the bug I have been struggled with for one week must be caused by gcc version
why ar eyou using gcc4? that's not in breezy afaik
what are you trying to compile?
coz if I type apt-get install gcc, the default version is 4.0
How can I uninstall the gcc related packages I have just installed completely??
and any other packages you want to completely remove
I just hope to remove the packages I installed when i type apt-get install gcc
